questions.question: What does the Oath of Citizenship promise allegiance to?

possible_answers.answer_text: His Majesty King Charles the Third

questions.quote: I swear (or affirm) That I will be faithful And bear true allegiance To **His Majesty King Charles the Third** King of Canada His Heirs and Successors

questions.question: To which principles does the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms begin with?

possible_answers.answer_text: Supremacy of God and the rule of law

questions.quote: The Charter begins with the words, “Whereas Canada is founded upon principles that recognize the **supremacy of God and the rule of law.**”

questions.question: What rights does the Canadian law guarantee regarding language?

possible_answers.answer_text: Equal status for English and French throughout the country
Preference for the French language only
Preference for the English language only

questions.quote: The Charter attempts to summarize fundamental freedoms while also setting out additional rights. The most important of these include: Official Language Rights and Minority Language Educational Rights — **French and English have equal status** in Parliament and throughout the government.

questions.question: What is one responsibility that accompanies the right to vote in Canada?
questions.quote: These include: Voting in elections — **The right to vote comes with a responsibility to vote** in federal, provincial or territorial and local elections.
